summary: This document is a chain of emails from February 2020 between attorneys and federal prosecutors regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling interviews with a victim/witness, media coverage of a related civil lawsuit, and investigative steps including contacting family members.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.role: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing a client (a victim/witness) in the SDNY Epstein investigation. He is coordinating interview scheduling and sharing information about a civil lawsuit filing with federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be part of the legal team involved in the case.

persons.name: Kevin Boyle
persons.role: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, part of the law firm representing the client.

persons.name: John Koeltl
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge assigned to the civil lawsuit filed by Robert Glassman's client.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Mentioned as the magistrate judge assigned to the civil lawsuit.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the SDNY investigation. The emails discuss investigating specific conduct by him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as someone whose specific conduct is part of the investigation.

persons.name: Moskowitz
persons.context: Mentioned as having already reached out to Robert Glassman's legal team. Likely another attorney or investigator.

connections.description: Both are attorneys copied on the same emails, coordinating on the SDNY investigation and a related civil lawsuit.
Both are attorneys at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP, working on the same case.
Glassman is representing a victim bringing a civil lawsuit against Epstein's estate/investigation target.
Glassman's client's allegations involve Maxwell, making her a subject of the investigation.
Mentioned together in the context of investigating their specific conduct.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Robert Glassman files a civil lawsuit on behalf of his client against Jeffrey Epstein. This is reported in the media.

events.title: Media Coverage of Lawsuit
events.description: Multiple news outlets (NY Daily News, NY Post, The Sun, Daily Mail) publish stories about the new Epstein accuser and her lawsuit.

events.title: Meeting with Victim/Witness
events.description: A meeting is scheduled between federal prosecutors, Robert Glassman, and his client to discuss the investigation.

events.title: Proposed Interview Dates
events.description: Federal prosecutors propose dates to interview Robert Glassman's client as part of the SDNY investigation.

events.title: Rescheduled Interview Window
events.description: Robert Glassman proposes the week of February 24th as a better time for his client to be interviewed.

keyFacts: A civil lawsuit was filed on January 17, 2020, by attorney Robert Glassman on behalf of a client accusing Jeffrey Epstein.
The SDNY investigation was actively seeking to interview this victim/witness in late 2019 and early 2020, with scheduling discussions spanning from December 2019 to February 2020.
The investigation planned to corroborate the victim's account by interviewing her family members, including her mother (who was overseas), siblings, and a key witness.
The civil lawsuit was assigned to Judge John Koeltl and Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses.
The email chain shows coordination between victim's counsel (Glassman) and federal prosecutors, including sharing of the complaint and discussion of media coverage.
